Detailed Description

Implements IDzJsonIO for writing JSON to a file.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzJsonWriter::DzJsonWriter ( QIODevice *  dev  ) 

General Constructor.

Parameters:
filename The path of the file to write to. Any existing file will be overwritten.
DzJsonWriter::~DzJsonWriter (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

bool DzJsonWriter::addItem ( const QString &  val  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::addItem( const QString &val ) Adds a string value as an item in the current array. Calls to this function are only valid when an array is the current top-level state.

Parameters:
val The string value. This should be the 'raw' string value, i.e. quotes will be added when writing, and quotes have already been stripped when reading. Also, any special characters in the string will be escaped when writing and have already been un-escaped when reading.
Returns:
true if the item was successfully added, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
bool DzJsonWriter::addItem ( int  val  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::addItem( int val ) Adds a numeric value as an item to the current array. Calls to this function are only valid when an array is the current top-level state.

Parameters:
val The integer value of the item to add to the array.
Returns:
true if the item was successfully added, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.

Parameters:

Returns:

bool DzJsonWriter::addItem ( bool  val  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::addItem( bool val ) Adds a boolean value to the current array. Boolean values in JSON are written as 'true' and 'false'. Calls to this function are only valid when an array is the current top-level state.

Parameters:

bool DzJsonWriter::addItemNull (  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::addItemNull() Adds a null value to the current array. Null values in JSON are written as 'null'. Calls to this function are only valid when an array is the current top-level state.

Returns:
true if the item was successfully added, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.

bool DzJsonWriter::addMemberNull ( const QString &  name  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::addMemberNull( const QString &name ) Adds a null value as a member of the current object. This is written out to the file as 'null'. Calls to this function are only valid when an object is the current top-level state.

Parameters:
name The name of the member.
Returns:
true if the member was successfully added, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
bool DzJsonWriter::finishArray (  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::finishArray() Marks the end of the currently active array. The object or array that the current array belongs to becomes active. When this is called for the root array, it marks the end of the JSON data. All calls to startArray() or startMemberArray() must be matched with a call to this function.

Returns:
true if the current array was successfully closed, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
bool DzJsonWriter::finishObject (  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::finishObject() Marks the end of the currently active object. The object or array that the current object belongs to becomes active. When this is called for the root object, it marks the end of the JSON data. All calls to startObject() or startMemberObject() must be matched with a call to this function.

Returns:
true if the current object was successfully closed, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
QString DzJsonWriter::getLastError (  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::getLastError()

Returns:
A string containing a description of the the last error that occurred in the interface.

int &  doublePercision 
) const

Gets the precision for writing floats and doubles. Defaults to 7.

Parameters:

doublePercision The precision for doubles

bool DzJsonWriter::startArray ( bool  multiLine = true  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::startArray( bool multiLine ) Starts a new JSON array. This call is valid only at the root or inside of another array. When at the root, this starts the array that is represented by the contents of the JSON file. When in an array, this starts a new array as an item in the current array. Each call to startArray() must be matched with a call to finishArray(). After a call to startArray(), subsequent calls to addItem() will add items to the most recently created array.

Parameters:
multiLine This is a styling hint when writing a file as to whether or not the contents of the array are written out on the same line or on multiple lines.
Returns:
true if a new array was successfully created, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
bool DzJsonWriter::startMemberArray ( const QString &  name,
bool  multiLine = true 
) [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::startMemberArray( const QString &name, bool multiLine ) Starts a new JSON array as a member of the current object. This call is only valid inside of an object. Each call to startMemberArray() must be matched with a call to finishArray(). After a call to startMemberArray(), subsequent calls to addItem() will add items to the most recently created array.

Parameters:
name The name of the member array.
multiLine This is a styling hint when writing a file as to whether or not the contents of the array are written out on the same line or on multiple lines.
Returns:
true if a new array was successfully created, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
bool DzJsonWriter::startMemberObject ( const QString &  name,
bool  multiLine = true 
) [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::startMemberObject( const QString &name, bool multiLine ) Starts a new JSON object as a member of the current object. This call is only valid inside of another object. Each call to startMemberObject() must be matched with a call to finishObject(). After a call to startMemberObject(), subsequent calls to addMember() will add members to the most recently created object.

Parameters:
name The name of the member object.
multiLine This is a styling hint when writing a file as to whether or not the contents of the object are written out on the same line or on multiple lines.
Returns:
true if a new object was successfully created, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
bool DzJsonWriter::startObject ( bool  multiLine = true  )  [virtual]

Implementation of IDzJsonIO::startObject( bool multiLine ) Starts a new JSON object. This call is valid only at the root or inside of an array. When at the root, this starts the object that is represented by the contents of the JSON file. When in an array, this starts a new object as an item in the array. Each call to startObject() must be matched with a call to finishObject(). After a call to startObject(), subsequent calls to addMember() will add members to the most recently created object.

Parameters:
multiLine This is a styling hint when writing a file as to whether or not the contents of the object are written out on the same line or on multiple lines.
Returns:
true if a new object was successfully created, otherwise false. Call getLastError() to get a description of the error when this function returns false.
